name: Hilton Chicago

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights. The rooms were very clean and nice, and the bed was quite confortable. I loved that the pillows were soft, and clean, and there were plenty of them. The location was great, and I liked the self park option. We don't get to travel much, but love coming to Chicago at least once a year. The room temp was way too hot, which made my in-hotel experience very disappointing. I like it at 68 degrees, less for sleeping, but the room felt like 80. We asked for the temp to be lowered, but in the end, the temp stayed the same, even with the windows open all night. I should note the outside temp was about 15-25 degrees. Unless I bring a large fan with, I won't stay again because of this. Sorry.
reviews.title: Temperature of the room ruined my stay

reviews.text: This is a huge hotel on S Michigan Ave and decorated very much in a classic, European style. The location is perfect for the galleries and museums of Chicago, however, a 15-20 minute walk to any significant shopping areas. I was there for a conference and the facilities and amount/variety of rooms are enormous. In terms of accommodation, the rooms are large with big comfy beds, ample working space, and plenty of hanging space with real coat hangers. However, the bathrooms are small with very little space sround the basin for your toiletries. Another down side is that rooms have very small windows for natural light and there are few options to brighten the rooms with light fittings - it feels quite dim in the rooms. I found the staff at the hotel to be friendly and efficient without being obtrusive or obviously hanging around for tips.
reviews.title: Massive hotel, huge conference centre, dimly-lit rooms

reviews.text: A very pleasant stay in the Hilton Towers in Chicago. Very comfortable bed - where one can really get a good nights sleep. Although the TV screen kept turning itself on every so often duting the night. One of those touch screen ones, I suspect that I wasn't deactivating it properly. But then surely you don't have to read the users manual just to use the TV screen! Other small but strange thing - the minibar was locked and there was just no key to be found. not sure what tthat was all about. Breakfast very good - quality of products and plenty of them. Fresh omelets made to order too which is always welcome. Doormen and bellboys extremely helpful and couteous. I would recommend this hotel - only thing is that its about a 7 dollar taxi ride to the main shopping area. Oh, and a great sushi restaurant can be found just two blocks away.
reviews.title: whatever happened to the minibar?

reviews.text: Happy that I stayed here for a single night only. The hotel is old, carpets need updates, furniture reminded me of 80's movies and there was nothing charming about the hotel. I was on a business trip and needed a hotel closer to downtown. Nothing other than location is recommendable about this hotel.
reviews.title: Nothing good other than being in downtown

reviews.text: My son and I traveled to Chicago to see the Bears play at Soldier Field and we couldn't have picked a better place to stay. The hotel was close to the cta (train from O'Hare) station and within walking distance of Shedd Aquarium, Field Museum, Soldier Field, and so much more. We had a room with a lakefront view. Everything was absolutely wonderful.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here in December to attend the Joffrey Ballet at the Auditorium Theater (just 2 blocks away) and visit the Art Institute (about 6 blocks away). This is a great location for the South Loop, and also reasonably close to the Loop north of the river. It's a very large, older hotel, but the rooms are in good shape and well furnished. Our room with two double beds also had two full bathrooms. Room service food was excellent, and the breakfast buffet was way beyond the normal -- well prepared eggs, french toast, etc, delicious pastries and an omelet bar. The room rate was reasonable for Chicago. We had an interior room, and it would be worth asking for a room with a view of the lake. Parking was expensive but convenient.
reviews.title: Very good hotel near museums and parks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall very nice hotel. We had gone to the Bears game that weekend and could not have asked for a better location. The Bears players were actually staying here too for the night before the game. The hotel is nice. Rooms a little dated but the common areas are updated and very nice. The only downsides were the parking. The self lot was full so the only option for parking was valet at $55.00 for the night. IF we wanted to park at the hotel, it was the only option. Also the fitness center. You can walk the track or use the pool complimentary but were charged to use the fitness equipment. But overall, it was a great location for what we needed for the weekend and we would stay here again.
reviews.title: Long weekend

reviews.text: I recently spent 2 nights here on a visit to the University of Chicago. Beyond a good S. Michigan location there is little to recommend. The hotel was almost sold out to convention visitors and I checked in later in the day. The first room offered was tiny with a partial view of an interior roof. The staff cheerfully and promptly found me another but it really wasn't much better. The bathroom was tiny, ill-lit and redolent of cigarette smoke from another room....or was the the odor counteractant? One tiny window with an interior view added to the gloom. The walls, furniture and furnishings were tattered and chipped. And it's sad: I have stayed at this hotel for decades; first as an excited young child seeing his first big city, later when searching for a college and still later over holidays with my own young family. It has beautiful bones but faces perhaps insurmountable challenges with too many small rooms and out of date mechanicals.
reviews.title: Sadly faded dowager-I remember when she was queen

reviews.text: My 13-year-old daughter and I stayed here for one night before I was to give a workshop. We had a 2 double beds / 2 bath room on an executive floor and everything was clean, comfortable, and exactly as we needed it to be. Having 2 bathrooms was a real plus even with just 2 of us on this trip! The executive floor is very much worth the extra amount paid because the continental breakfast is wonderful and the lounge is very nice. Great coffee! It's very easy to get in and out of the hotel but the turns inside the parking garage are VERY tight so you have to be really careful maneuvering around inside it. Desk staff were great and while we were there less than 12 hours, everything was fantastic. I would definitely stay here again, and am considering it for a family trip in the spring.
reviews.title: Wish I had more time!

reviews.text: Great historic hotel (built in 1927's) situated in a very convenient location. However, there is much needed improvement inside the hotel. Our heater is totally broken on our second night and we had engineer came to look into the issue in the morning. But there is no update whatsoever from them to entire day. When I got back from conference at the end of the day, I called the front desk and they have no idea regarding the issues. Eventually they did provide a room switch but communications among the staffs/department is poor.
reviews.title: ok stay but could be better

reviews.text: I was staying in Chicago from a Saturday-Friday in mid-November for a trade show at McCormick. From check-in on I was very impressed by the service, style and comfort at the Hilton. Knowing how long I would be staying, the desk clerk game me a larger room with two bathrooms on an executive level floor. This game me access to a complimentary breakfast and drinks in the evening. Flowers that my boyfriend had ordered were waiting at the desk for me to pick up (One of very few complaints: he had paid $30 to have them delivered to my room.) If you can afford executive level, I highly recommend it. Private elevators, the breakfast, complimentary wifi and turn down service are worth it...all the facts about the hotel and chocolates were a nice treat when I returned back to my room late after the show.
reviews.title: Stayed for a week and loved it.

reviews.text: My room was always clean when I got back and like I mentioned, turn down service was a nice perk. I had trouble with one of the lamps being unplugged (and the plug was located behind a heavy TV stand) so I couldn't flip the switch for lights when I walked in. After calling the front desk they had an electrician up to fix it within 10 minutes. The service at this Hilton is top notch, and considering how VERY busy the hotel was I was impressed.
reviews.title: Great location across McCormick Park

reviews.text: The building itself is beautiful too. Take a tour and make sure to look in the grand ballroom - amazing! Didn't get a chance to make it to the gym, but it looked great and clean and wasn't crowded. The Irish pub was fun and served great fish and chips.
reviews.title: Great Room & Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is one of those classic, old, lots of character hotels. Similiar to the St. Francis on Union Square in San Francisco. Great location across the street from the park and musuems. About 1.5 blocks from the train. Great pool and gym.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: I stayed there for the marathon weekend in October 2011. First time running the marathon and first time in Chicago. The room was impeccable, comfortable and everything was like brand new. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable. The service at the front desk was better than I have ever experienced. They accommodated my every request. I needed oatmeal & brown rice heated on a daily basis for my marathon and they supported my requests in the lobby restaurant. The hotel was across the street from the starting line and finish line. This is the best place to stay if you're running the marathon.
reviews.title: Big room

reviews.text: After several stays here I think I can sum this place up with my headline.
reviews.title: The Good, The Bad , & The Ugly

reviews.text: The Good...The Hilton Chicago is a Grand Lady of Chicago. Beyond the history of being ground zero of 1968 Democratic convention. Several major motion pictures have this hotel featured in their film productions. ER used to film the helipad scenes here, and the fight at the end of the Fugitive was exclusively filmed throughout the hotel. Most recently the hotel was used in Little Fockers as the sight of the Dinner Symposium where Ben Stiller was the featured speaker. You can not beat this location you are right across the street from Grant Park (so historic on it's own) You also have Buddy Guy's right around the corner (By far the best Blues club in the city).
reviews.title: A perfect hotel!

reviews.text: The Bad...As a meeting planner it is a very expensive property to do business with. IT is the second strongest union hotel in the city of Chicago. Simple things take time to get done and you are not allowed to do anything but sign BEO's. Because of it's location several tours pick up outside on 8th street. 1 is the Casino bus and with it there are some dodgy characters running about the lobby at times.
reviews.title: Lots of history but that's in the past

reviews.text: The Ugly...This property is a century old. Maintenance is something lacking in some cases. For example in my shower (Room 2565) there is black mold along the grout line. On the Wall above the sink there is blood. 2562 is an upgraded room as it is reserved for Gold/Diamond members (something I indeed am).
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Overall I would say this is a great place to stay, but as I said it is a little tired...
reviews.title: More of a Kennel than a Hotel

description: Classic meets cool as Hilton Chicago embarks upon a $150 million renovation in celebration of our 85th birthday. The fresh, new vibe inspired by traditional, design rich elements pulls its inspiration from the hotel’s original architecture and intertwines a dynamic and contemporary spin. With the renovation underway, the hotel has already introduced over 400 new guest rooms, 13 new hospitality suites, a new technologically versatile Grab & Go – SNAX and a new restaurant with private dining space and bar – 720 South Bar & Grill. The new contemporary guestrooms have been cultivated with ornamental lacquer finishes, soft leather and rich, bronze wood detailing accented by a cool color palette of velvet and silk textured accents. Guestroom media capabilities include a 37 inch flat screen television, in room touch concierge panel, HCN Navigator computer and wireless and wired internet access. Following a day exploring Chicago, decompress at the largest Chicago hotel athletic club with running track, take a dip in our indoor pool facility or catch some rays on our sundeck during the spring and summer months.Located on Michigan Avenue in the South Loop, the Hilton Chicago is 1.6 miles to McCormick Place, along the Shuttle Route to McCormick Place and the first stop on the returning route from the convention center. Directly across the street from Grant Park and walking distance to Millennium Park, Buckingham Fountain, Shedd Aquarium, Field Museum, Adler Planetarium, Lake Michigan, Buddy Guy’s Legends, South Loop dining and art galleries, Museum of Contemporary Photography, The “Loop” – Chicago’s Financial district, State Street Shopping, Soldier Field as well as two short “L” stops to Chinatown.
